tweets.text: @FreyaHolmer Congratulations! These videos are so inspirational as an explainer and a creator, wishing you all of the success you deserve!
RT @smtology: @mrejfox Oh -- another one! Do you want to specialize in a certain technology stack or use a little of everything? (Looking a…
https://t.co/whqE513Ebh

@izzyz Would love your advice on this, it's the area I am least familiar with, in the past I've interfaced with R models hosted on Heroku accessed thru REST API with plumber (https://t.co/xv8DbA1vSQ) but I would love to run models in the browser, especially for simplified models
Some ideas from GPT-3 https://t.co/No0GsfZDcC

I would want it to have tools to generate simulated election data, normalizing names to IDs, formatting and filenaming headshots for candidates, utilities for finding winners and vote differences, maybe some boilerplates for modeling
If there was an npm package that combined a bunch of tools/patterns for analyzing and modifying election data, like a lodash for elections, what are the types of things you would want for it to have?
@smtology These are all great… particularly the last two, things I hadn’t considered in depth until working as a contractor for years, wish they had been laid out for this way at the beginning

- Are you interested in working on one-off projects that can be highly customized or on reusable t…
Leaving little annotations in red pen in Sunday’s paper for my wife who doesn’t exist yet

Imagine accumulating wealth and power and hiring the most intelligent designers, developers, and creative people on earth for decades and then doing essentially nothing of impact during the greatest calamity of our lives

Where is all your radical thinking now? Where are the moonshot hackathons? Where is the corporate sponsorship of open source solutions? Why wasn’t existing tech radically repositioned to help the most affected? Y’all wanted to gossip on Clubhouse instead?

Lots has been said about the governments failure in responding to the global pandemic. But I think that given the power of tech to help our current situation, the failure to do anything impactful for everyday Americans is profound

There is nothing more American than deeply rejecting the systems you were born into and stopping at nothing to tear them down and replace them (the key is to keep doing that) and unfortunately there has been very little of that in my lifetime

Really genuinely enjoying this era where we are all thinking radical change, and there is this rolling boil of people popping up and saying "hey, while we are dismantling broken systems, here's one I noticed" and, like, YES! That too! Take it all apart and rebuild it.
nothing like riding your tiny motorcycle up and down the hudson river on a beautiful july 4th day
Sometimes I feel down about New York City and then I buy a buttered roll for $1 and feel better
also if you are calling the cops because you heard "over 30 gunshots" on july 3rd in brooklyn you're fucking up (just heard this)
listening to fireworks across brooklyn, and also cops attempting to chase them down on the scanner, beautiful july night
most new yorkers want their photo taken
@IjeomaOluo just show him this https://t.co/qbNt0d5Lm9
Adulthood is saving the best podcasts for when youre traveling
In a symbolic performance of American freedom, I am walking around my apartment this AM in my boxers and a backwards hat, Happy July 4th.
So when I drink a beer and watch some fireworks tonight, I know there’s a lot of work to be done, but sometimes America is very beautiful.

While racists rally, Kendrick Lamar is performing at a Barack Obama white house for the 4th of July. 

That’s the America that I love.
America is smart, rich, and strong enough to ensure the freedom and resources it has can benefit every single American, not just rich whites
I love talking to people I disagree with who earnestly believe their politics are best for America. At the heart we all love liberty.
I know when I am arguing politics with someone who argues because they want to win, and someone who argues because they love this country.
There is just so much land and life between New York and California. I love that drive. And I love that the whole way, you’re still at home.
Even when I am sometimes appalled at this country and some of the people in it. Even when I am so angry I yell. This is home.
It is our duty to know the evils this country has done in the name of justice and freedom and ensure we take responsibility and don’t repeat
The flipside of our freedom is that it is our duty to fight for what is right. To ensure all men and women live equally. That’s American.
America is beautiful in so many ways because people before us shed blood, sweat, and tears. So many things we enjoy & take for granted.
I truly truly love America. We are a special, beautiful, strong, emotional country. But I love anyone who can unite around freedom.
Happy 4th of July.
RT @TylerHuckabee: I found it. The most American sentence of all time. https://t.co/a0dq4wUCgx
